name: coact
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to work together, especially to achieve something or to have an effect: We look at how different types of messages coact with the communication network. Risk processes may co-act, increasing the likelihood of negative outcomes.
More examplesFewer examplesThe adapter sits on top of the grate and co-acts with the mounting to securely affix the device to the grate.The coacting cutters in each set are arranged in parallel pairs. The study set out to identify variables that predict cohesion of teams in coacting sports.
